title: ENIAC, the world s first general-purpose digital computer, turns 80 years old today legendary hulking machine was 1,000x faster than its nearest rival
summary: ENIAC, the world's first general-purpose digital computer, was unveiled in 1946. It was 1,000x faster than its nearest rival, revolutionizing computing capabilities. This innovation paved the way for future advancements in technology.
insight: Pioneering technology sets the stage for exponential computing progress

title: AMD Ryzen 7 9850X3D vs Ryzen 7 9800X3D faceoff an extra $30 buys you very little performance
summary: The AMD Ryzen 7 9850X3D and Ryzen 7 9800X3D were compared in a comprehensive test, revealing that an extra $30 for the 9850X3D brings minimal performance gains. The two CPUs excelled in gaming and productivity tasks, but the margin between them was small. The results suggest that the 9800X3D is a more cost-effective option.
insight: Extra $30 buys you negligible performance differences in gaming CPUs.

title: Steam to add hardware specs to reviews optional feature could help you dodge poorly optimized games
summary: Steam's optional 'hardware specs' feature in reviews helps users gauge reliability.
insight: Reviews influenced by hardware can be misleading to other players.

title: Framework's latest update brings more bad news about memory and storage pricing crisis RAM costs increased to $12 to $16 per GB, recommends purchasing some models elsewhere for Framework Laptop DIY Edition customers
summary: Framework's latest update reveals increased RAM costs ($12-$16/GB), affecting laptop customers. The company recommends purchasing RAM from other sources for DIY Edition customers. Framework will monitor memory chip prices monthly and aim to match the weighted average cost.
insight: RAM price surge impacts laptop manufacturers and customers significantly.

title: Asus ROG Crosshair X870E Dark Hero Motherboard Review
summary: The Asus ROG Crosshair X870E Dark Hero is a high-end AMD motherboard offering premium features and solid performance.
insight: Optimized for AMD processors, delivering exceptional gaming and productivity performance

title: WD Green SN3000 1TB SSD Review: A diamond in the rough
summary: The WD Green SN3000 SSD defies expectations, delivering impressive performance despite its budget-friendly price. It rivals more expensive options in terms of speed and efficiency, making it an attractive option for those on a budget. Overall, it's a solid choice for everyday computing needs.
insight: Budget SSDs can now rival high-end performance options

title: OpenAI launches GPT-5.3-Codex-Spark on Cerebras chips marks AI giants first production deployment away from Nvidia
summary: OpenAI has released GPT-5.3-Codex-Spark, its first AI model on Cerebras chips, marking a shift away from Nvidia.
insight: OpenAI diversifies AI production with Cerebras chip deployment outside Nvidia.

title: Tachyum forced to shutter R&D office due to unpaid rent, wages, and taxes firm still claims forthcoming Prodigy chip will have a 21x performance leap on Nvidia Rubin Ultra
summary: Tachyum has been forced to vacate its R&D office due to unpaid rent, wages, and taxes. The company still claims its Prodigy chip will offer a significant performance leap over Nvidia's Rubin Ultra. The situation raises concerns about the firm's financial stability and ability to deliver on its promises.
insight: Financial struggles threaten Tachyum's ability to deliver promised tech advancements

title: MyMiniFactory acquires Thingiverse to save 3D printing file sharing from AI Thingverse has eight million users and 2.5 million 'things'
summary: MyMiniFactory has acquired Thingiverse, the world's oldest 3D printing file sharing site, with 8 million users and 2.5 million 'things'. This acquisition aims to save the platform from potential AI-related changes. Thingiverse has been a cornerstone of the 3D printing community for years.
insight: AI-driven change threatens to disrupt 3D printing file sharing platforms.

title: MSI GeForce RTX 5090 Lightning Z review: RTX 5090 Ti, anyone?
summary: The MSI RTX 5090 Lightning Z outperforms the Nvidia Founders Edition, delivering improved performance thanks to increased power limits and dual power connectors.
insight: Dual power and higher limits boost Nvidia's highest-end gaming GPU performance.

title: Creality Falcon A1 Pro Review An easy-to-use, fully enclosed 20W laser engraver with a built-in HD camera
summary: The Creality Falcon A1 Pro is a fully enclosed laser engraver with a 20W blue laser, pre-assembled for easy use, featuring auto focus, real-time flame detection, and an HD camera for accurate workpiece positioning.
insight: Accurate workpiece positioning enhances precision and reliability in laser engraving.

title: Android 17 Beta 1 released with H.266/VVC support, camera improvements, and more
summary: Google releases Android 17 Beta 1 with H.266/VVC support, camera enhancements, and performance improvements.
insight: Android 17 prioritizes tablet, foldable, and desktop compatibility now

title: STMicroelectronics Stellar P3E quad-core Arm Cortex-R52+ automotive MCU features Neural-ART AI accelerator
summary: STMicroelectronics introduces Stellar P3E, a quad-core Arm Cortex-R52+ automotive MCU with a Neural-ART AI accelerator. This MCU simplifies Electronic Control Units (ECUs) by consolidating powertrain functions into a single module. It features smart sensing, predictive maintenance, and virtual sensor applications.
insight: Enables ECU consolidation, reducing complexity and costs in automotive systems

title: Avalue EMX-PTLP A thin mini-ITX motherboard powered by up to an Intel Core Ultra 7 358H Panther Lake-H SoC
summary: The Avalue EMX-PTLP is a thin mini-ITX motherboard powered by Intel's Panther Lake-H processor, supporting up to a 12-core Intel Core Ultra 7 358H SoC and delivering up to 180 TOPS for AI and industrial automation deployments.
insight: Enables high-performance AI and automation in compact industrial applications.

title: SlimeVR Butterfly Trackers nRF52833-based, ultra-slim, full-body VR trackers offer up to 48h battery life (Crowdfunding)
summary: The SlimeVR Butterfly Trackers offer ultra-slim, full-body VR tracking with up to 48 hours of battery life. Designed for virtual reality gaming, motion capture, and VTubing, these trackers use a custom 2.4 GHz ESB protocol for seamless tracking. They are open-hardware, IMU-based, and compatible with Nordic Semi's nRF52833 wireless MCU.
insight: Revolutionizing VR tracking with ultra-slim, long-lasting, and precise technology.

title: de next-RAP8-EZBOX An ultra-compact, fanless or actively-cooled Intel Core i7-1365UE Raptor Lake embedded system
summary: The de next-RAP8-EZBOX is an ultra-compact, fanless/embedded system powered by Intel Core i7-1365UE. It offers 16GB of LPDDR5x memory, an M.2 2280 M-Key slot, and various interfaces. Suitable for space-constrained autonomous systems or industrial robots.
insight: Powerful processing in small form factor for industrial automation.

title: CHUWI CoreBook Air Plus 16 laptop review Part 1: Specs, unboxing, teardown, and first boot
summary: CHUWI CoreBook Air Plus 16 laptop review starts with specs, unboxing, and teardown.
insight: Mid-range AMD Ryzen 5 6600H laptop offers affordable high-performance computing.

title: Open Stack standalone 4G LTE IoT board runs RTOS on Quectel EC200U LTE module (Crowdfunding)
summary: The Open Stack is a standalone 4G LTE IoT board that runs RTOS directly on the Quectel EC200U LTE module, reducing power consumption, costs, and physical footprint.
insight: Empowering low-power, low-cost IoT applications with reduced complexity.

title: VU GPSDR A low-cost GPS-disciplined SDR expansion board for the Vivid Unit RK3399 touchscreen SBC
summary: The VU GPSDR is a low-cost GPS-disciplined SDR expansion board designed for the Vivid Unit RK3399-based touchscreen SBC, providing high frequency stability and timing accuracy thanks to its integrated GPS module.
insight: GPS-disciplined SDR offers high frequency stability at a low cost.

title: PicoClaw ultra-lightweight personal AI Assistant runs on just 10MB of RAM
summary: PicoClaw is an ultra-lightweight personal AI assistant running on 10MB RAM, built on top of the nanobot project, with a significantly reduced codebase compared to OpenClaw.
insight: PicoClaw enables AI assistants on highly resource-constrained embedded systems.

title: Beelink ME Pro 2-bay Intel N95/N150 NAS and mini PC supports 5GbE networking, up to 3x M.2 MVMe SSDs
summary: Beelink ME Pro is a compact 2-bay NAS and mini PC that supports 5GbE networking and up to 3x M.2 M.2 NVMe SSDs, making it suitable for home NAS, media server, and small office applications.
insight: Combines NAS and mini PC capabilities for versatile applications.

title: TOPST D3-G maker SBC is powered by Telechips TCT8050 Dolphin3 Cortex-A72/A53/R5 automotive-grade SoC
summary: The TOPST D3-G is a single board computer powered by the Telechips TCT8050 SoC, featuring a quad-core Cortex-A72, four Cortex-A53 cores, and a real-time Cortex-R5 core. It comes with 4GB or 8GB LPDDR4 RAM, 32GB eMMC flash, and multiple connectivity options. The board is designed for automotive-grade applications.
insight: Automotive-grade SBC offers advanced processing and connectivity capabilities.

title: Black Sesame Technologies Wudang C1200 cross-domain automotive SoCs feature up to 10x Cortex-A78AE cores
summary: Black Sesame Technologies' Wudang C1200 family offers cross-domain automotive SoCs with up to 10x Cortex-A78AE cores, supporting various in-vehicle functions.
insight: Advanced processing capabilities for safer, more efficient autonomous driving systems.

title: Geniatech DB3506 is a full-featured Rockchip RK3506 development board and 3.5-inch industrial SBC
summary: The Geniatech DB3506 is an industrial-grade SBC designed for various embedded applications, featuring a Rockchip RK3506 SoC, 256 MB to 1 GB RAM, and multiple interfaces for connectivity and expansion.
insight: Industrial-grade SBC for IoT, control, and HMI systems development.

title: Linux 6.19 Release Main changes, Arm, RISC-V, and MIPS architectures
summary: Linus Torvalds has released Linux 6.19, with expected updates including Arm, RISC-V, and MIPS architectures. The release comes with no major surprises and a relatively calm merge window. Users outside the US may find the new kernel a good option to explore.
insight: Linux 6.19 brings incremental updates to Arm, RISC-V, and MIPS architectures.

title: 86-type Smart Home control panel features a 3.5-inch display, physical buttons, Bluetooth SIG Mesh gateway
summary: The Tuya WiFi Smart Center Control Panel offers a hybrid smart home solution combining a capacitive touchscreen with physical buttons, Wi-Fi, and Bluetooth SIG Mesh connectivity for instant local control and seamless integration.
insight: Enhancing smart home convenience with tactile buttons and mesh networking

title: Texas Instruments unveils MSPM33C321A mixed-signal Cortex-M33 microcontroller with 256KB SRAM, 1MB flash
summary: Texas Instruments has unveiled the MSPM33C321A, a 160MHz Arm Cortex-M33 microcontroller with 1MB flash and 256KB SRAM, featuring various digital and analog peripherals. The device supports low power consumption and has a separate VBAT power domain. It also has a variant with 512KB flash called the MSPM33C3219.
insight: Advanced security and low power consumption for IoT applications.

title: Compact, fanless DIN-Rail Intel Core Ultra 5 235U/7 265U industrial PC targets AMR, robotics, and computer vision
summary: The ASUS IoT PE1000U is a compact, fanless industrial PC designed for AMR, robotics, and computer vision applications. It features Intel Core Ultra 5 processors, supporting SO-DIMM DDR5 memory, SATA and NVMe storage, and dual 4K display outputs. The device operates in a wide temperature range, accepts 9-36V DC power input, and includes built-in ignition control.
insight: Enabling edge AI in harsh industrial environments with minimal maintenance.

title: $199+ M5Stack AI Pyramid Computing Box Linux AI mini PC is based on Axera AX8850 SoC
summary: M5Stack AI Pyramid Computing Box is an AI mini PC with Axera AX8850 SoC, featuring 4/8GB RAM, 32GB eMMC, and multiple ports for AI applications such as vision gateways and smart security systems.
insight: Powerful Edge AI computing for IoT applications at an affordable price point

title: Review of XIAO ePaper DIY Kit EE02 13.3-inch color E-Ink display with SenseCraft HMI and Arduino
summary: Seeed Studio sent a sample of the XIAO ePaper DIY Kit EE02 for review, featuring a 13.3-inch color E-Ink display with ESP32-S3 board, Wi-Fi, and Bluetooth connectivity.
insight: E Ink display technology offers low-power, high-contrast visual solutions for IoT and embedded systems.

title: Cubie A7S A compact Allwinner A733 SBC with USB-C DisplayPort, GbE, WiFi 6, PCIe Gen3 FFC connector, GPIO headers
summary: Radxa's Cubie A7S is a compact SBC featuring the Allwinner A733 octa-core processor, offering a balance between compactness and feature richness.
insight: Compact SBC with versatile features and high-performance processor options.

title: Qualcomm IPQ5424 embedded router board supports 22 Gbps tri-band Wi-Fi 7 and dual 10GbE networking
summary: The Wallys Communications DR5424 is a high-performance embedded router board featuring a Qualcomm IPQ5424 SoC with tri-band Wi-Fi 7 connectivity and 10GbE networking capabilities.
insight: Ultra-fast Wi-Fi 7 connectivity for seamless high-bandwidth applications.

title: reComputer Jetson AGX Orin Developer Kit GMSL Bundle features 8x GMSL2 camera interfaces, 10GbE networking
summary: The reComputer Jetson AGX Orin Developer Kit GMSL Bundle is a compact, high-performance development kit equipped with 8 GMSL2 camera interfaces and 10GbE networking capabilities. It features the NVIDIA Jetson AGX Orin 32GB/64GB system-on-module with an 8-core Arm Cortex-A78AE CPU and 1792 NVIDIA CUDA cores. This bundle is ideal for AI, computer vision, and edge computing applications.
insight: Accelerates AI and computer vision development with 10GbE and GMSL2
